author: Jeremy Lazell
title: School’s out
text:
Catch Morph in Coventry Coasteering, The Lizard
Scramble, climb, leap and swim around Bass Point, with National Trust rangers helping you to spot seals and starfish.
Wed; £45; ages 8+; nationaltrust.org.uk/lizard
Carnival, Swanage
The seafront is the stage for a week of family fun, including sand-sculpting, aerobatics displays, dog shows, a carnival procession and fireworks.
Until Sat; free; swanagecarnival.com
Food festival, Whitstable
The Kent harbour town’s oyster festival has food stalls, an outdoor cinema, kite workshops for kids and a junior disco. Until Sun; prices vary; whitstableoysterfestival.co.uk
Cycling, London
Enjoy seven hours of car-free cycling as roads close between Buckingham Palace and St Paul’s Cathedral. Six entertainment zones will offer stunt cyclists, DJs and games.
Sun; free; prudentialridelondon.co.uk
Family Music festival, Bishop’s Stortford
Basement Jaxx and Little Dragon headline Standon Calling, which has kid’s craft, cookery, drum and dance workshops, as well as a heated pool.
Fri-Sun; from £50, children aged 4-12 £13.50; standon-calling.co
